parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: ARSP_ARSP_SCALE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed scale (scale from IAS to CAS/EAS)
parameter.long_desc: Scale can either be entered manually, or estimated in-flight by setting ARSP_SCALE_EST to 1.

parameter.name: ARSP_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for true sideslip fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ARSP_BETA_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator sideslip measurement noise
parameter.long_desc: Sideslip measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ARSP_SCALE_EST
parameter.long_desc: Turns the automatic airspeed scale (scale from IAS to CAS/EAS) on or off. It is recommended level (keeping altitude) while performing the estimation. Set to 1 to start estimation (best when already flying). Set to 0 to end scale estimation. The estimated scale is then saved in the ARSP_ARSP_SCALE parameter.

parameter.name: ARSP_SC_P_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed scale process noise
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed scale process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ARSP_TAS_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for true airspeed fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ARSP_TAS_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed measurement noise
parameter.long_desc: True airspeed measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ARSP_W_P_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator wind process noise
parameter.long_desc: Wind process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ATT_ACC_COMP
parameter.short_desc: Acceleration compensation based on GPS velocity

parameter.name: ATT_EXT_HDG_M
parameter.short_desc: External heading usage mode (from Motion capture/Vision) Set to 1 to use heading estimate from vision. Set to 2 to use heading from motion capture

parameter.name: ATT_MAG_DECL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is not used in normal operation, as the declination is looked up based on the GPS coordinates of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ATT_W_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to avoid using the magnetometer.

parameter.name: BAT_ADC_CHANNEL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter specifies the ADC channel used to monitor voltage of main power battery. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT_A_PER_V
parameter.long_desc: The voltage seen by the 3.3V ADC multiplied by this factor will determine the battery current. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT_CAPACITY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the capacity of the attached battery.

parameter.name: BAT_CNT_V_CURR
parameter.short_desc: Scaling from ADC counts to volt on the ADC input (battery current)
parameter.long_desc: This is not the battery current, but the intermediate ADC voltage. A value of -1 signifies that the board defaults are used, which is highly recommended.

parameter.name: BAT_CNT_V_VOLT
parameter.short_desc: Scaling from ADC counts to volt on the ADC input (battery voltage)
parameter.long_desc: This is not the battery voltage, but the intermediate ADC voltage. A value of -1 signifies that the board defaults are used, which is highly recommended.

parameter.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameter.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameter.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameter.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameter.long_desc: Defines the number of cells the attached battery consists of.

parameter.name: BAT_R_INTERNAL
parameter.short_desc: Explicitly defines the per cell internal resistance
parameter.long_desc: If non-negative, then this will be used in place of BAT_V_LOAD_DROP for all calculations.

parameter.name: BAT_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the source of battery data. The value 'Power Module' means that measurements are expected to come from a power module. If the value is set to 'External' then the system expects to receive mavlink battery status messages.

parameter.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered full under a mild load. This will never be the nominal voltage of 4.2V

parameter.name: BAT_V_DIV
parameter.long_desc: This is the divider from battery voltage to 3.3V ADC voltage. If using e.g. Mauch power modules the value from the datasheet can be applied straight here. A value of -1 means to use the board default.

parameter.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameter.long_desc: Defines the voltage where a single cell of the battery is considered empty. The voltage should be chosen before the steep dropoff to 2.8V. A typical lithium battery can only be discharged down to 10% before it drops off to a voltage level damaging the cells.

parameter.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: Voltage drop per cell on full throttle
parameter.long_desc: This implicitely defines the internal resistance to maximum current ratio and assumes linearity. A good value to use is the difference between the 5C and 20-25C load. Not used if BAT_R_INTERNAL is set.

parameter.name: BAT_V_OFFS_CURR
parameter.short_desc: Offset in volt as seen by the ADC input of the current sensor
parameter.long_desc: This offset will be subtracted before calculating the battery current based on the voltage.

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the delay between image integration start and strobe firing

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_FBACK
parameter.long_desc: Enables camera capture feedback

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Change time measurement

values.value: Get timestamp of mid exposure (active high)
Get timestamp of mid exposure (active low)

parameter.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameter.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameter.long_desc: Selects the trigger interface

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameter.name: TRIG_PINS
parameter.long_desc: Selects which pin is used, ranges from 1 to 6 (AUX1-AUX6 on px4_fmu-v2 and the rail pins on px4_fmu-v4). The PWM interface takes two pins per camera, while relay triggers on every pin individually. Example: Value 56 would trigger on pins 5 and 6. For GPIO mode Pin 6 will be triggered followed by 5. With a value of 65 pin 5 will be triggered followed by 6. Pins may be non contiguous. I.E. 16 or 61. In GPIO mode the delay pin to pin is < .2 uS.

parameter.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameter.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
parameter.short_desc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin

parameter.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameter.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the engine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss and geofence safety logic.

parameter.name: CBRK_GPSFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for GPS failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 240024 will disable the GPS failure detection. If this check is enabled, then the sensor check will fail if the GPS module is missing. It will also check for excessive signal noise on the GPS receiver and warn the user if detected. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_VELPOSERR
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for position error check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 201607 will disable the position and velocity accuracy checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH
parameter.short_desc: Arm authorization parameters, this uint32_t will be split between starting from the LSB: - 8bits to authorizer system id - 16bits to authentication method parameter, this will be used to store a timeout for the first 2 methods but can be used to another parameter for other new authentication methods. - 7bits to authentication method - one arm = 0 - two step arm = 1 * the MSB bit is not used to avoid problems in the conversion between int and uint
parameter.long_desc: Default value: (10 << 0 | 1000 << 8 | 0 << 24) = 256010 - authorizer system id = 10 - authentication method parameter = 10000msec of timeout - authentication method = during arm

parameter.name: COM_ARM_CHK_ESCS
parameter.short_desc: Require all the ESCs to be detected to arm
parameter.long_desc: This param is specific for ESCs reporting status. Normal ESCs configurations are not affected by the change of this param.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_AB
parameter.short_desc: Maximum value of EKF accelerometer delta velocity bias estimate that will allow arming. Note: ekf2 will limit the delta velocity bias estimate magnitude to be less than EKF2_ABL_LIM * FILTER_UPDATE_PERIOD_MS * 0.001 so this parameter must be less than that to be useful

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_GB
parameter.short_desc: Maximum value of EKF gyro delta angle bias estimate that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF height innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_POS
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF position innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF velocity innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF yaw innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Maximum accelerometer inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_GYR
parameter.short_desc: Maximum rate gyro inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MAG_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum magnetic field inconsistency between units that will allow arming Set -1 to disable the check

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MIS_REQ
parameter.long_desc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a valid mission.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_SWISBTN
parameter.short_desc: Arm switch is only a button
parameter.long_desc: The default uses the arm switch as real switch. If parameter set button gets handled like stick arming.

values.value: Arm switch is a switch that stays on when armed
Arm switch is a button that only triggers arming and disarming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_WO_GPS
parameter.long_desc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without GPS signal.

parameter.name: COM_ASPD_FS_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe action when bad airspeed measurements are detected. Ensure the COM_ASPD_STALL parameter is set correctly before use.

values.value: log a message, warn the user
log a message, warn the user, switch to non-airspeed TECS mode
log a message, warn the user, switch to non-airspeed TECS mode, switch to Return mode after COM_ASPD_FS_DLY seconds

parameter.name: COM_ASPD_FS_DLY
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed fault detection delay before RTL (Experimental)
parameter.long_desc: RTL delay after bad airspeed measurements are detected if COM_ASPD_FS_ACT is set to 4. Ensure the COM_ASPD_STALL parameter is set correctly before use. The failsafe start and stop delays are controlled by the COM_TAS_FS_T1 and COM_TAS_FS_T2 parameters. Additional protection against persistent airspeed sensor errors can be enabled using the COM_TAS_FS_INNOV parameter, but these addtional checks are more prone to false positives in windy conditions.

parameter.name: COM_ASPD_STALL
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum indicated airspeed at which the wing can produce 1g of lift. It is used by the airspeed sensor fault detection and failsafe calculation to detect a significant airspeed low measurement error condition and should be set based on flight test for reliable operation. The failsafe response is controlled by the COM_ASPD_FS_ACT parameter.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. The vehicle will also auto-disarm right after arming if it has not even flown, however the time will always be 10 seconds such that the pilot has enough time to take off. A negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by landing detection is disabled.

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_EF_C2T
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only below this current value

parameter.name: COM_EF_THROT
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only above this throttle value

parameter.name: COM_EF_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time

parameter.name: COM_FLIGHT_UUID
parameter.long_desc: This number is incremented automatically after every flight on disarming in order to remember the next flight UUID. The first flight is 0.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE1
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE2
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE3
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE4
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE5
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE6
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLT_PROFILE
parameter.long_desc: Describes the intended use of the vehicle. Can be used by ground control software or log post processing. This param does not influence the behavior within the firmware. This means for example the control logic is independent of the setting of this param (but depends on other params).

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink loss time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_REG_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink regain time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After a data link loss: after this this amount of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameter.name: COM_HOME_H_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_HOME_V_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_LOW_BAT_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes on low battery. Defaults to off

values.value: Return mode at critically low level, Land mode at current position if reaching dangerously low levels

parameter.name: COM_OA_BOOT_T
parameter.long_desc: The avoidance system running on the companion computer is expected to boot within this time and start providing trajectory points. If no avoidance system is detected a MAVLink warning message is sent.

parameter.name: COM_OBL_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameter.name: COM_OBL_RC_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set offboard loss failsafe mode when RC is available
parameter.long_desc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameter.name: COM_OF_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action. See COM_OBL_ACT and COM_OBL_RC_ACT to configure action

parameter.name: COM_POSCTL_NAVL
parameter.long_desc: This sets the flight mode that will be used if navigation accuracy is no longer adequate for position control. Navigation accuracy checks can be disabled using the CBRK_VELPOSERR parameter, but doing so will remove protection for all flight modes.

values.value: Assume use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Altitude mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to MANUAL.
Assume no use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Land mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to TERMINATION.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position failsafe activation delay
parameter.long_desc: This sets number of seconds that the position checks need to be failed before the failsafe will activate. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a larger value between 5 and 10 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_EPH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal position error (EPH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_EPV
parameter.long_desc: This is the vertical position error (EPV) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_GAIN
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position probation gain factor
parameter.long_desc: This sets the rate that the loss of position probation time grows when position checks are failing. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications a value of 0 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_PROB
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position probation delay at takeoff
parameter.long_desc: The probation delay is the number of seconds that the EKF innovation checks need to pass for the position to be declared good after it has been declared bad. The probation delay will be reset to this parameter value when takeoff is detected. After takeoff, if position checks are passing, the probation delay will reduce by one second for every lapsed second of valid position down to a minimum of 1 second. If position checks are failing, the probation delay will increase by COM_POS_FS_GAIN seconds for every lapsed second up to a maximum of 100 seconds. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a value of 1 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_RC_ARM_HYST
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 1000 requires the stick to be held in the arm or disarm position for 1 second.

parameter.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 0 requires a valid RC transmitter setup. Setting this to 1 allows joystick control and disables RC input handling and the associated checks. A value of 2 will generate RC control data from manual input received via MAVLink instead of directly forwarding the manual input data.

parameter.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection the rc lost flag is set to true

parameter.name: COM_RC_OVERRIDE
parameter.short_desc: Enable RC stick override of auto modes
parameter.long_desc: When an auto mode is active (except a critical battery reaction) moving the RC sticks gives control back to the pilot in manual position mode immediately. Only has an effect on multicopters and VTOLS in multicopter mode.

parameter.name: COM_RC_STICK_OV
parameter.long_desc: If an RC stick is moved more than by this amount the system will interpret this as override request by the pilot.

parameter.name: COM_TAS_FS_INNOV
parameter.long_desc: This specifies the minimum airspeed test ratio as logged in estimator_status.tas_test_ratio required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller values make it more sensitive. Start with a value of 1.0 when tuning. When estimator_status.tas_test_ratio is > 1.0 it indicates the inconsistency between predicted and measured airspeed is large enough to cause the navigation EKF to reject airspeed measurements. The time required to detect a fault when the threshold is exceeded depends on the size of the exceedance and is controlled by the COM_TAS_FS_INTEG parameter. The subsequent failsafe response is controlled by the COM_ASPD_FS_ACT parameter.

parameter.name: COM_TAS_FS_INTEG
parameter.long_desc: This sets the time integral of airspeed test ratio exceedance above COM_TAS_FS_INNOV required to trigger a failsafe. For example if COM_TAS_FS_INNOV is 100 and estimator_status.tas_test_ratio is 2.0, then the exceedance is 1.0 and the integral will rise at a rate of 1.0/second. A negative value disables the check. Larger positive values make the check less sensitive, smaller positive values make it more sensitive. The failsafe response is controlled by the COM_ASPD_FS_ACT parameter.

parameter.name: COM_TAS_FS_T1
parameter.long_desc: Delay before stopping use of airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is bad. The failsafe response is controlled by the COM_ASPD_FS_ACT parameter.

parameter.name: COM_TAS_FS_T2
parameter.long_desc: Delay before switching back to using airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is good. The failsafe response is controlled by the COM_ASPD_FS_ACT parameter.

parameter.name: COM_VEL_FS_EVH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal velocity error (EVH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_AH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CHSK
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the system will skip the comms hold wp on data link loss and will directly fly to airfield home

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_CH_T
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should wait at the comms hold waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_N
parameter.long_desc: After more than this number of data link timeouts the aircraft returns home directly

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU accel magnitude that allows IMU bias learning. If the magnitude of the IMU accelerometer vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of high manoeuvre accelerations and IMU nonlinerity and scale factor errors on the delta velocity bias estimates

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_GYRLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU gyro angular rate magnitude that allows IMU bias learning. If the magnitude of the IMU angular rate vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of rapid rotation rates and associated errors on the delta velocity bias estimates

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_LIM
parameter.short_desc: Accelerometer bias learning limit. The ekf delta velocity bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_TAU
parameter.short_desc: Time constant used by acceleration and angular rate magnitude checks used to inhibit delta velocity bias learning. The vector magnitude of angular rate and acceleration used to check if learning should be inhibited has a peak hold filter applied to it with an exponential decay. This parameter controls the time constant of the decay

parameter.name: EKF2_ACC_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU accelerometer bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_AID_MASK
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling data fusion and aiding methods
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use GPS data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to inhibit IMU delta velocity bias estimation 3 : Set to true to enable vision position fusion 4 : Set to true to enable vision yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 7 is true. 5 : Set to true to enable multi-rotor drag specific force fusion 6 : set to true if the EV observations are in a non NED reference frame and need to be rotated before being used 7 : Set to true to enable GPS yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 4 is true.

parameter.name: EKF2_ANGERR_INIT
parameter.short_desc: 1-sigma tilt angle uncertainty after gravity vector alignment

parameter.name: EKF2_ARSP_THR
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed fusion threshold. A value of zero will deactivate airspeed fusion. Any other positive value will determine the minimum airspeed which will still be fused. Set to about 90% of the vehicles stall speed. Both airspeed fusion and sideslip fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_FUSE_BETA to activate sideslip fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_ASPD_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Upper limit on airspeed along individual axes used to correct baro for position error effects

parameter.name: EKF2_ASP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_AVEL_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Auxillary Velocity Estimate (e.g from a landing target) delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Barometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for barometric and GPS height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_X
parameter.short_desc: X-axis ballistic coefficient used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model. This should be adjusted to minimise variance of the X-axis drag specific force innovation sequence

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y-axis ballistic coefficient used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model. This should be adjusted to minimise variance of the Y-axis drag specific force innovation sequence

parameter.name: EKF2_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for synthetic sideslip fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_DECL_TYPE
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling handling of magnetic declination
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable functions. 0 : Set to true to use the declination from the geo_lookup library when the GPS position becomes available, set to false to always use the EKF2_MAG_DECL value. 1 : Set to true to save the EKF2_MAG_DECL parameter to the value returned by the EKF when the vehicle disarms. 2 : Set to true to always use the declination as an observation when 3-axis magnetometer fusion is being used.

parameter.name: EKF2_DRAG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Specific drag force observation noise variance used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model. Increasing it makes the multi-rotor wind estimates adjust more slowly

parameter.name: EKF2_EVA_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision angle observations used when the vision system does not supply error estimates

parameter.name: EKF2_EVP_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision position observations used when the vision system does not supply error estimates

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Vision Position Estimator delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for vision estimate fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of VI sensor focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of VI sensor focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of VI sensor focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_FUSE_BETA
parameter.short_desc: Boolean determining if synthetic sideslip measurements should fused
parameter.long_desc: A value of 1 indicates that fusion is active Both sideslip fusion and airspeed fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_ARSP_THR to activate airspeed fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Baro deadzone range for height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the value of deadzone applied to negative baro innovations. Deadzone is enabled when EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ > 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_MAX_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Height above ground level for ground effect zone
parameter.long_desc: Sets the maximum distance to the ground level where negative baro innovations are expected.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_CHECK
parameter.long_desc: Set bits to 1 to enable checks. Checks enabled by the following bit positions 0 : Minimum required sat count set by EKF2_REQ_NSATS 1 : Minimum required GDoP set by EKF2_REQ_GDOP 2 : Maximum allowed horizontal position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPH 3 : Maximum allowed vertical position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPV 4 : Maximum allowed speed error set by EKF2_REQ_SACC 5 : Maximum allowed horizontal position rate set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 6 : Maximum allowed vertical position rate set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 7 : Maximum allowed horizontal speed set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 8 : Maximum allowed vertical velocity discrepancy set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: GPS measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_MASK
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of GPS antenna in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of GPS antenna in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of GPS antenna in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_P_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GPS horizontal position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_TAU
parameter.long_desc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_V_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GPS velocity fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_V_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for gps horizontal velocity

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU rate gyro bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Rate gyro noise for covariance prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_HDG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for magnetic heading fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_HEAD_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for magnetic heading fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_HGT_MODE
parameter.short_desc: Determines the primary source of height data used by the EKF
parameter.long_desc: The range sensor option should only be used when for operation over a flat surface as the local NED origin will move up and down with ground level.

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of IMU in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of IMU in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of IMU in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the learned bias is for

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_X
parameter.short_desc: Learned value of magnetometer X axis bias. This is the amount of X-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Learned value of magnetometer Y axis bias. This is the amount of Y-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGBIAS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Learned value of magnetometer Z axis bias. This is the amount of Z-axis magnetometer bias learned by the EKF and saved from the last flight. It must be set to zero if the ground based magnetometer calibration is repeated

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGB_K
parameter.short_desc: Maximum fraction of learned mag bias saved at each disarm. Smaller values make the saved mag bias learn slower from flight to flight. Larger values make it learn faster. Must be > 0.0 and <= 1.0

parameter.name: EKF2_MAGB_VREF
parameter.short_desc: State variance assumed for magnetometer bias storage. This is a reference variance used to calculate the fraction of learned magnetometer bias that will be used to update the stored value. Smaller values will make the stored bias data adjust more slowly from flight to flight. Larger values will make it adjust faster

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal acceleration threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method. This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered horizontal acceleration is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for body magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_E_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for earth magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for magnetometer XYZ component fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Integer controlling the type of magnetometer fusion used - magnetic heading or 3-component vector. The fuson of magnetomer data as a three component vector enables vehicle body fixed hard iron errors to be learned, but requires a stable earth field. If set to 'Automatic' magnetic heading fusion is used when on-ground and 3-axis magnetic field fusion in-flight with fallback to magnetic heading fusion if there is insufficient motion to make yaw or magnetic field states observable. If set to 'Magnetic heading' magnetic heading fusion is used at all times If set to '3-axis' 3-axis field fusion is used at all times. If set to 'VTOL custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic', but if fusing airspeed, magnetometer fusion is only allowed to modify the magnetic field states. This can be used by VTOL platforms with large magnetic field disturbances to prevent incorrect bias states being learned during forward flight operation which can adversely affect estimation accuracy after transition to hovering flight. If set to 'MC custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic, but if there are no earth frame position or velocity observations being used, the magnetometer will not be used. This enables vehicles to operate with no GPS in environments where the magnetic field cannot be used to provide a heading reference. Prior to flight, the yaw angle is assumed to be constant if movement tests controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter indicate that the vehicle is static. This allows the vehicle to be placed on the ground to learn the yaw gyro bias prior to flight. If set to 'None' the magnetometer will not be used under any circumstance. Other sources of yaw may be used if selected via the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_YAWLIM
parameter.short_desc: Yaw rate threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method. This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered yaw rate is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_MIN_OBS_DT
parameter.short_desc: Minimum time of arrival delta between non-IMU observations before data is downsampled. Baro and Magnetometer data will be averaged before downsampling, other data will be point sampled resulting in loss of information

parameter.name: EKF2_MIN_RNG
parameter.short_desc: Minimum valid range for the range finder

parameter.name: EKF2_MOVE_TEST
parameter.long_desc: Scales the threshold tests applied to IMU data used to determine if the vehicle is static or moving. See parameter descriptions for EKF2_GPS_CHECK and EKF2_MAG_TYPE for further information on the functionality affected by this parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for non-aiding position hold

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_TOUT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum lapsed time from last fusion of measurements that constrain velocity drift before the EKF will report the horizontal nav solution as invalid

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow measurement delay relative to IMU measurements Assumes measurement is timestamped at trailing edge of integration period

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for optical flow fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor
parameter.long_desc: (when it's reported quality metric is at the minimum set by EKF2_OF_QMIN). The following condition must be met: EKF2_OF_N_MAXN >= EKF2_OF_N_MIN

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the maximum

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of optical flow focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of optical flow focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of optical flow focal point in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN
parameter.short_desc: Optical Flow data will only be used if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XN
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the negative X axis. This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XP
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the positive X axis This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forward flight, then this will be a negative number

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YN
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the negative Y axis. This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the negative Y (LH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this will be a negative number

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YP
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the positive Y axis. This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the positive Y (RH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this will be a negative number

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the Z axis. This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the Z body axis

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_GPS_H
parameter.short_desc: Required GPS health time on startup
parameter.long_desc: Minimum continuous period without GPS failure required to mark a healthy GPS status. It can be reduced to speed up initialization, but it's recommended to keep this unchanged for a vehicle.

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_NSATS
parameter.short_desc: Required satellite count to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_SACC
parameter.short_desc: Required speed accuracy to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_AID
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the range finder measurements to estimate it's height even if range sensor is not the primary height source. It will only do so if conditions for range measurement fusion are met. This enables the range finder to be used during low speed and low altitude operation, eg takeoff and landing, where baro interference from rotor wash is excessive and can corrupt EKF state estimates. It is intended to be used where a vertical takeoff and landing is performed, and horizontal flight does not occur until above EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX. If vehicle motion causes repeated switching between the primary height sensor and range finder, an offset in the local position origin can accumulate. Also range finder measurements are less reliable and can experience unexpected errors. For these reasons, if accurate control of height relative to ground is required, it is recommended to use the MPC_ALT_MODE parameter instead, unless baro errors are severe enough to cause problems with landing and takeoff.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum absolute altitude (height above ground level) allowed for range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle absolute altitude exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_IGATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size used for innovation consistency checks for range aid fusion
parameter.long_desc: A lower value means HAGL needs to be more stable in order to use range finder for height estimation in range aid mode

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed for range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle horizontal speed exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Range finder measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for range finder fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for range finder fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of range finder origin in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of range finder origin in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of range finder origin in body frame

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_SFE
parameter.short_desc: Range finder range dependant noise scaler
parameter.long_desc: Specifies the increase in range finder noise with range.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAS_GATE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_POS
parameter.short_desc: Time constant of the position output prediction and smoothing filter. Controls how tightly the output track the EKF states

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Time constant of the velocity output prediction and smoothing filter

parameter.name: EKF2_TERR_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Terrain altitude process noise - accounts for instability in vehicle height estimate

parameter.name: EKF2_WIND_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for wind velocity prediction

parameter.name: EV_TSK_RC_LOSS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for RC Loss. When enabled, an alarm tune will be played via buzzer or ESCs, if supported. The alarm will sound after a disarm, if the vehicle was previously armed and only if the vehicle had RC signal at some point. Particularly useful for locating crashed drones without a GPS sensor.

parameter.name: EV_TSK_STAT_DIS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for displaying the vehicle status using arm-mounted LEDs. When enabled and if the vehicle supports it, LEDs will flash indicating various vehicle status changes. Currently PX4 has not implemented any specific status events. -

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_X_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full roll stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the body y rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full pitch stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Z_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the body z rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full yaw stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ARSP_MODE
parameter.long_desc: For small wings or VTOL without airspeed sensor this parameter can be used to enable flying without an airspeed reading

parameter.name: FW_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameter.short_desc: Whether to scale throttle by battery power level
parameter.long_desc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The fixed wing should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max thrust at lower battery percentages. i.e. if cruise speed is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_FLPS
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment for flaps configuration
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to the pitch trim whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_FLPS
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment for flaps configuration
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_LND_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during landing

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_TO_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during take-off

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max pitch for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max roll for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_PR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_PR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the elevator input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_P_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_RATT_TH
parameter.long_desc: Manual input needed in order to override attitude control rate setpoints and instead pass manual stick inputs as rate setpoints

parameter.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameter.short_desc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameter.long_desc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator (rudder, airbrakes, ...) to counteract this effect.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameter.name: FW_RR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameter.name: FW_RR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the aileron input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_RSP_OFF
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the roll setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the roll setpoint and should correspond to the typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_R_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_WR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_WR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_WR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_WR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_YR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the rudder input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameter.long_desc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to 0 to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameter.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the aircraft its following. A value of 18-25 meters works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: FW_L1_R_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: L1 controller roll slew rate limit
parameter.long_desc: The maxium change in roll angle setpoint per second.

parameter.name: FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC
parameter.short_desc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for landing
parameter.long_desc: Multiplying this factor with the minimum airspeed of the plane gives the target airspeed the landing approach. FW_AIRSPD_MIN * FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC

parameter.name: FW_LND_EARLYCFG
parameter.long_desc: When disabled, the landing configuration (flaps, landing airspeed, etc.) is only activated on the final approach to landing. When enabled, it is already activated when entering the final loiter-down (loiter-to-alt) waypoint before the landing approach. This shifts the (often large) altitude and airspeed errors caused by the configuration change away from the ground such that these are not so critical. It also gives the controller enough time to adapt to the new configuration such that the landing approach starts with a cleaner initial state.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameter.name: FW_LND_HHDIST
parameter.short_desc: Landing heading hold horizontal distance. Set to 0 to disable heading hold

parameter.name: FW_LND_THRTC_SC
parameter.short_desc: Throttle time constant factor for landing
parameter.long_desc: Set this parameter to less than 1.0 to make the TECS throttle loop react faster during landing than during normal flight (i.e. giving efficiency and low motor wear at high altitudes but control accuracy during landing). During landing, the TECS throttle time constant (FW_T_THRO_CONST) is multiplied by this value.

parameter.name: FW_LND_TLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing throttle limit altitude (relative landing altitude)
parameter.long_desc: Default of -1.0 lets the system default to applying throttle limiting at 2/3 of the flare altitude.

parameter.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameter.long_desc: This is turned off by default and a waypoint or return altitude is normally used (or sea level for an arbitrary land position).

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximum positive pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimum negative pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_R_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The maximum roll the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ALT_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Automatically adjust throttle to account for decreased air density at higher altitudes. Start with a scale factor of 1.0 and adjust for different propulsion systems. When flying without airspeed sensor this will help to keep a constant performance over large altitude ranges. The default value of 0 will disable scaling.

parameter.name: FW_THR_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. Most airframes have a value of 0.5-0.7.

parameter.name: FW_THR_IDLE
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set above desired idle rpm.

parameter.name: FW_THR_LND_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Throttle limit during landing below throttle limit altitude
parameter.long_desc: During the flare of the autonomous landing process, this value will be set as throttle limit when the aircraft altitude is below FW_LND_TLALT.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For overpowered aircraft, this should be reduced to a value that provides sufficient thrust to climb at the maximum pitch angle PTCH_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For electric aircraft this will normally be set to zero, but can be set to a small non-zero value if a folding prop is fitted to prevent the prop from folding and unfolding repeatedly in-flight or to provide some aerodynamic drag from a turning prop to improve the descent rate. For aircraft with internal combustion engine this parameter should be set for desired idle rpm.

parameter.name: FW_THR_SLEW_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum slew rate for the commanded throttle

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_A
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_MDEL
parameter.long_desc: Delay between starting attitude control and powering up the throttle (giving throttle control to the controller) Before this timespan is up the throttle will be set to FW_THR_IDLE, set to 0 to deactivate

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_PMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum pitch before the throttle is powered up (during motor delay phase)
parameter.long_desc: This is an extra limit for the maximum pitch which is imposed in the phase before the throttle turns on. This allows to limit the maximum pitch angle during a bungee launch (make the launch less steep).

parameter.name: LAUN_CAT_T
parameter.long_desc: LAUN_CAT_A for LAUN_CAT_T serves as threshold to trigger launch detection.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed is above this value, the TECS controller will try to decrease airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: If the airspeed falls below this value, the TECS controller will try to increase airspeed more aggressively.

parameter.name: FW_AIRSPD_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: The fixed wing controller tries to fly at this airspeed.

parameter.name: FW_GND_SPD_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The controller will increase the commanded airspeed to maintain this minimum groundspeed to the next waypoint.

parameter.name: FW_T_CLMB_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the best climb rate that the aircraft can achieve with the throttle set to THR_MAX and the airspeed set to the default value. For electric aircraft make sure this number can be achieved towards the end of flight when the battery voltage has reduced. The setting of this parameter can be checked by commanding a positive altitude change of 100m in loiter, RTL or guided mode. If the throttle required to climb is close to THR_MAX and the aircraft is maintaining airspeed, then this parameter is set correctly. If the airspeed starts to reduce, then the parameter is set to high, and if the throttle demand required to climb and maintain speed is noticeably less than FW_THR_MAX, then either FW_T_CLMB_MAX should be increased or FW_THR_MAX reduced.

parameter.name: FW_T_HGT_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse vertical acceleration and barometric height to obtain an estimate of height rate and height. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the barometer, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_INTEG_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the integrator gain on the control loop. Increasing this gain increases the speed at which speed and height offsets are trimmed out, but reduces damping and increases overshoot. Set this value to zero to completely disable all integrator action.

parameter.name: FW_T_PTCH_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the pitch demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in height. The default value of 0.0 will work well provided the pitch to servo controller has been tuned properly.

parameter.name: FW_T_RLL2THR
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this gain turn increases the amount of throttle that will be used to compensate for the additional drag created by turning. Ideally this should be set to approximately 10 x the extra sink rate in m/s created by a 45 degree bank turn. Increase this gain if the aircraft initially loses energy in turns and reduce if the aircraft initially gains energy in turns. Efficient high aspect-ratio aircraft (eg powered sailplanes) can use a lower value, whereas inefficient low aspect-ratio models (eg delta wings) can use a higher value.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This sets the maximum descent rate that the controller will use. If this value is too large, the aircraft can over-speed on descent. This should be set to a value that can be achieved without exceeding the lower pitch angle limit and without over-speeding the aircraft.

parameter.name: FW_T_SINK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the sink rate of the aircraft with the throttle set to THR_MIN and flown at the same airspeed as used to measure FW_T_CLMB_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_T_SPDWEIGHT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter adjusts the amount of weighting that the pitch control applies to speed vs height errors. Setting it to 0.0 will cause the pitch control to control height and ignore speed errors. This will normally improve height accuracy but give larger airspeed errors. Setting it to 2.0 will cause the pitch control loop to control speed and ignore height errors. This will normally reduce airspeed errors, but give larger height errors. The default value of 1.0 allows the pitch control to simultaneously control height and speed. Note to Glider Pilots - set this parameter to 2.0 (The glider will adjust its pitch angle to maintain airspeed, ignoring changes in height).

parameter.name: FW_T_SPD_OMEGA
parameter.long_desc: This is the cross-over frequency (in radians/second) of the complementary filter used to fuse longitudinal acceleration and airspeed to obtain an improved airspeed estimate. Increasing this frequency weights the solution more towards use of the airspeed sensor, whilst reducing it weights the solution more towards use of the accelerometer data.

parameter.name: FW_T_THRO_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS throttle control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_THR_DAMP
parameter.long_desc: This is the damping gain for the throttle demand loop. Increase to add damping to correct for oscillations in speed and height.

parameter.name: FW_T_TIME_CONST
parameter.long_desc: This is the time constant of the TECS control algorithm (in seconds). Smaller values make it faster to respond, larger values make it slower to respond.

parameter.name: FW_T_VERT_ACC
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum vertical acceleration (in m/s/s) either up or down that the controller will use to correct speed or height errors. The default value of 7 m/s/s (equivalent to +- 0.7 g) allows for reasonably aggressive pitch changes if required to recover from under-speed conditions.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag If flight termination is enabled (@CBRK_FLIGHTTERM set to 0), the autopilot will terminate the flight and set all the outputs to their failsafe value as soon as the attitude_failure flag is set. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_P_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that pitch has to exceed FD_FAIL_P before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R
parameter.long_desc: Maximum roll angle before FailureDetector triggers the attitude_failure flag If flight termination is enabled (@CBRK_FLIGHTTERM set to 0), the autopilot will terminate the flight and set all the outputs to their failsafe value as soon as the attitude_failure flag is set. Setting this parameter to 0 disables the check

parameter.name: FD_FAIL_R_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that roll has to exceed FD_FAIL_R before being considered as a failure.

parameter.name: NAV_FT_DST
parameter.long_desc: The distance in meters to follow the target at

parameter.name: NAV_FT_FS
parameter.long_desc: The side to follow the target from (front right = 0, behind = 1, front = 2, front left = 3)

parameter.name: NAV_FT_RS
parameter.short_desc: Dynamic filtering algorithm responsiveness to target movement lower numbers increase the responsiveness to changing long lat but also ignore less noise

parameter.name: NAV_MIN_FT_HT
parameter.long_desc: The minimum height in meters relative to home for following a target

parameter.name: GPS_1_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Main GPS.

parameter.name: GPS_2_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Secondary GPS.

parameter.name: GPS_DUMP_COMM
parameter.short_desc: Dump GPS communication to a file
parameter.long_desc: If this is set to 1, all GPS communication data will be published via uORB, and written to the log file as gps_dump message.

parameter.name: GPS_UBX_DYNMODEL
parameter.long_desc: u-blox receivers support different dynamic platform models to adjust the navigation engine to the expected application environment.

parameter.name: GPS_YAW_OFFSET
parameter.short_desc: Heading/Yaw offset for dual antenna GPS
parameter.long_desc: Heading offset angle for dual antenna GPS setups that support heading estimation. (currently only for the Trimble MB-Two). Set this to 0 if the antennas are parallel to the forward-facing direction of the vehicle and the first antenna is in front. The offset angle increases counterclockwise. Set this to 90 if the first antenna is placed on the right side and the second on the left side of the vehicle.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_LT
parameter.long_desc: The time in seconds the system should do open loop loiter and wait for GPS recovery before it goes into flight termination. Set to 0 to disable.

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch in degrees during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_R
parameter.long_desc: Roll in degrees during the loiter

parameter.name: NAV_GPSF_TR
parameter.long_desc: Thrust value which is set during the open loop loiter

parameter.name: GF_ACTION
parameter.long_desc: Note: Setting this value to 4 enables flight termination, which will kill the vehicle on violation of the fence. Due to the inherent danger of this, this function is disabled using a software circuit breaker, which needs to be reset to 0 to really shut down the system.

parameter.name: GF_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: Select which altitude reference should be used 0 = WGS84, 1 = AMSL

parameter.name: GF_COUNT
parameter.long_desc: Set how many subsequent position measurements outside of the fence are needed before geofence violation is triggered

parameter.name: GF_MAX_HOR_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_MAX_VER_DIST
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical distance in meters the vehicle can be from home before triggering a geofence action. Disabled if 0.

parameter.name: GF_SOURCE
parameter.long_desc: Select which position source should be used. Selecting GPS instead of global position makes sure that there is no dependence on the position estimator 0 = global position, 1 = GPS

parameter.name: ISBD_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Iridium (with MAVLink).

parameter.name: ISBD_READ_INT
parameter.short_desc: Satellite radio read interval. Only required to be nonzero if data is not sent using a ring call

parameter.name: ISBD_STACK_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Time [ms] the Iridium driver will wait for additional mavlink messages to combine them into one SBD message Value 0 turns the functionality off

parameter.name: LNDFW_AIRSPD_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum airspeed allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_XY_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDFW_VEL_Z_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameter.name: LNDFW_XYACC_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal (x,y body axes) acceleration allowed in the landed state (m/s^2)

parameter.name: LNDMC_ALT_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The system will obey this limit as a hard altitude limit. This setting will be consolidated with the GF_MAX_VER_DIST parameter. A negative value indicates no altitude limitation.

parameter.name: LNDMC_FFALL_THR
parameter.long_desc: Multicopter threshold on the specific force measured by accelerometers in m/s^2 for free-fall detection

parameter.name: LNDMC_FFALL_TTRI
parameter.long_desc: Seconds (decimal) that freefall conditions have to met before triggering a freefall. Minimal value is limited by LAND_DETECTOR_UPDATE_RATE=50Hz in landDetector.h

parameter.name: LNDMC_LOW_T_THR
parameter.long_desc: Defines the commanded throttle value below which the land detector considers the vehicle to have "low thrust". This is one condition that is used to detect the ground contact state. The value is calculated as val = (MPC_THR_HOVER - MPC_THR_MIN) * LNDMC_LOW_T_THR + MPC_THR_MIN Increase this value if the system takes long time to detect landing.

parameter.name: LNDMC_ROT_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum allowed angular velocity around each axis allowed in the landed state.

parameter.name: LNDMC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s)

parameter.name: LNDMC_Z_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity allowed in the landed state (m/s up and down)

parameter.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_HI
parameter.long_desc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Higher 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameter.name: LND_FLIGHT_T_LO
parameter.long_desc: Total flight time of this autopilot. Lower 32 bits of the value. Flight time in microseconds = (LND_FLIGHT_T_HI << 32) | LND_FLIGHT_T_LO.

parameter.name: LTEST_ACC_UNC
parameter.long_desc: Variance of acceleration measurement used for landing target position prediction. Higher values results in tighter following of the measurements and more lenient outlier rejection

parameter.name: LTEST_MEAS_UNC
parameter.long_desc: Variance of the landing target measurement from the driver. Higher values results in less agressive following of the measurement and a smoother output as well as fewer rejected measurements.

parameter.name: LTEST_MODE
