parameter.long_desc: Configure the mode of the landing target. Depending on the mode, the landing target observations are used differently to aid position estimation. Mode Moving: The landing target may be moving around while in the field of view of the vehicle. Landing target measurements are not used to aid positioning. Mode Stationary: The landing target is stationary. Measured velocity w.r.t. the landing target is used to aid velocity estimation.

parameter.name: LTEST_POS_UNC_IN
parameter.long_desc: Initial variance of the relative landing target position in x and y direction

parameter.name: LTEST_SCALE_X
parameter.short_desc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor x axis
parameter.long_desc: Landing target x measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameter.name: LTEST_SCALE_Y
parameter.short_desc: Scale factor for sensor measurements in sensor y axis
parameter.long_desc: Landing target y measurements are scaled by this factor before being used

parameter.name: LTEST_VEL_UNC_IN
parameter.long_desc: Initial variance of the relative landing target velocity in x and y direction

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_XY
parameter.long_desc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz) Larger than data sheet to account for tilt error.

parameter.name: LPE_ACC_Z
parameter.long_desc: Data sheet noise density = 150ug/sqrt(Hz) = 0.0015 m/s^2/sqrt(Hz)

parameter.name: LPE_BAR_Z
parameter.short_desc: Barometric presssure altitude z standard deviation

parameter.name: LPE_EPH_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max EPH allowed for GPS initialization

parameter.name: LPE_EPV_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max EPV allowed for GPS initialization

parameter.name: LPE_FAKE_ORIGIN
parameter.short_desc: Enable publishing of a fake global position (e.g for AUTO missions using Optical Flow) by initializing the estimator to the LPE_LAT/LON parameters when global information is unavailable

parameter.name: LPE_FGYRO_HP
parameter.short_desc: Flow gyro high pass filter cut off frequency

parameter.name: LPE_FLW_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow z offset from center

parameter.name: LPE_FLW_RR
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow angular velocity noise gain

parameter.name: LPE_FUSION
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to fuse GPS data if available, also requires GPS for altitude init 1 : Set to true to fuse optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to fuse vision position 3 : Set to true to enable landing target 4 : Set to true to fuse land detector 5 : Set to true to publish AGL as local position down component 6 : Set to true to enable flow gyro compensation 7 : Set to true to enable baro fusion default (145 - GPS, baro, land detector)

bitmask.bit: fuse GPS, requires GPS for alt. init

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_VXY
parameter.short_desc: GPS xy velocity standard deviation. EPV used if greater than this value

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_XY
parameter.short_desc: Minimum GPS xy standard deviation, uses reported EPH if greater

parameter.name: LPE_GPS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Minimum GPS z standard deviation, uses reported EPV if greater

parameter.name: LPE_LAND_VXY
parameter.short_desc: Land detector xy velocity standard deviation

parameter.name: LPE_LAT
parameter.short_desc: Local origin latitude for nav w/o GPS

parameter.name: LPE_LDR_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Lidar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameter.name: LPE_LON
parameter.short_desc: Local origin longitude for nav w/o GPS

parameter.name: LPE_LT_COV
parameter.short_desc: Minimum landing target standard covariance, uses reported covariance if greater

parameter.name: LPE_PN_P
parameter.long_desc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameter.name: LPE_PN_T
parameter.short_desc: Terrain random walk noise density, hilly/outdoor (0.1), flat/Indoor (0.001)

parameter.name: LPE_PN_V
parameter.long_desc: Increase to trust measurements more. Decrease to trust model more.

parameter.name: LPE_SNR_OFF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Sonar z offset from center of vehicle +down

parameter.name: LPE_T_MAX_GRADE
parameter.short_desc: Terrain maximum percent grade, hilly/outdoor (100 = 45 deg), flat/Indoor (0 = 0 deg) Used to calculate increased terrain random walk nosie due to movement

parameter.name: LPE_VIS_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: Set to zero to enable automatic compensation from measurement timestamps

parameter.name: LPE_VXY_PUB
parameter.short_desc: Required velocity xy standard deviation to publish position

parameter.name: LPE_Z_PUB
parameter.short_desc: Required z standard deviation to publish altitude/ terrain

parameter.name: MAV_0_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run MAVLink.

parameter.name: MAV_0_FORWARD
parameter.short_desc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 0
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameter.name: MAV_0_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameter.name: MAV_0_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 0
parameter.long_desc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameter.name: MAV_1_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run MAVLink.

parameter.name: MAV_1_FORWARD
parameter.short_desc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 1
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameter.name: MAV_1_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameter.name: MAV_1_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 1
parameter.long_desc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameter.name: MAV_2_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run MAVLink.

parameter.name: MAV_2_FORWARD
parameter.short_desc: Enable MAVLink Message forwarding for instance 2
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, forward incoming MAVLink messages to other MAVLink ports if the message is either broadcast or the target is not the autopilot. This allows for example a GCS to talk to a camera that is connected to the autopilot via MAVLink (on a different link than the GCS).

parameter.name: MAV_2_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The MAVLink Mode defines the set of streamed messages (for example the vehicle's attitude) and their sending rates.

parameter.name: MAV_2_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Maximum MAVLink sending rate for instance 2
parameter.long_desc: Configure the maximum sending rate for the MAVLink streams in Bytes/sec. If the configured streams exceed the maximum rate, the sending rate of each stream is automatically decreased. If this is set to 0 a value of half of the theoretical maximum bandwidth is used. This corresponds to baudrate/20 Bytes/s (baudrate/10 = maximum data rate on 8N1-configured links).

parameter.name: MAV_BROADCAST
parameter.long_desc: This allows a ground control station to automatically find the drone on the local network.

parameter.name: MAV_FWDEXTSP
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming external setpoint messages will be directly forwarded to the controllers if in offboard control mode

parameter.name: MAV_HASH_CHK_EN
parameter.long_desc: Disabling the parameter hash check functionality will make the mavlink instance stream parameters continuously.

parameter.name: MAV_HB_FORW_EN
parameter.long_desc: The mavlink hearbeat message will not be forwarded if this parameter is set to 'disabled'. The main reason for disabling heartbeats to be forwarded is because they confuse dronekit.

parameter.name: MAV_ODOM_LP
parameter.long_desc: If set, it gets the data from 'vehicle_visual_odometry' instead of 'vehicle_odometry' serving as a loopback of the received ODOMETRY messages on the Mavlink receiver.

values.value: Default to 1, switch to 2 if GCS sends version 2

parameter.name: MAV_RADIO_ID
parameter.long_desc: When non-zero the MAVLink app will attempt to configure the radio to this ID and re-set the parameter to 0. If the value is negative it will reset the complete radio config to factory defaults.

values.value: Operator control unit / ground control station
Two-rotor VTOL using control surfaces in vertical operation in addition. Tailsitter.
Quad-rotor VTOL using a V-shaped quad config in vertical operation. Tailsitter.

parameter.name: MAV_USEHILGPS
parameter.short_desc: Use/Accept HIL GPS message even if not in HIL mode
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 incoming HIL GPS messages are parsed.

parameter.name: MPU_ACC_LPF_ENM
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter frequency for Accelerometer

parameter.name: MPU_GYRO_LPF_ENM
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter frequency for Gyro

parameter.name: COM_TAKEOFF_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Action after TAKEOFF has been accepted
parameter.long_desc: The mode transition after TAKEOFF has completed successfully.

parameter.name: MIS_ALTMODE
parameter.long_desc: 0: the system will follow a zero order hold altitude setpoint 1: the system will follow a first order hold altitude setpoint values follow the definition in enum mission_altitude_mode

parameter.name: MIS_DIST_1WP
parameter.short_desc: Maximal horizontal distance from home to first waypoint
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe check to prevent running mission stored from previous flight at a new takeoff location. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if the current waypoint is more distant than MIS_DIS_1WP from the home position.

parameter.name: MIS_DIST_WPS
parameter.long_desc: Failsafe check to prevent running missions which are way too big. Set a value of zero or less to disable. The mission will not be started if any distance between two subsequent waypoints is greater than MIS_DIST_WPS.

parameter.name: MIS_LTRMIN_ALT
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum altitude the system will always obey. The intent is to stay out of ground effect. set to -1, if there shouldn't be a minimum loiter altitude

parameter.name: MIS_MNT_YAW_CTL
parameter.short_desc: Enable yaw control of the mount. (Only affects multicopters and ROI mission items)
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, yaw commands will be sent to the mount and the vehicle will follow its heading towards the flight direction. If disabled, the vehicle will yaw towards the ROI.

parameter.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_ALT
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum altitude the system will take off to.

parameter.name: MIS_TAKEOFF_REQ
parameter.long_desc: If set, the mission feasibility checker will check for a takeoff waypoint on the mission.

parameter.name: MIS_YAW_ERR
parameter.short_desc: Max yaw error in degrees needed for waypoint heading acceptance

parameter.name: MIS_YAW_TMT
parameter.short_desc: Time in seconds we wait on reaching target heading at a waypoint if it is forced
parameter.long_desc: If set > 0 it will ignore the target heading for normal waypoint acceptance. If the waypoint forces the heading the timeout will matter. For example on VTOL forwards transition. Mainly useful for VTOLs that have less yaw authority and might not reach target yaw in wind. Disabled by default.

parameter.name: MPC_YAW_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Specifies the heading in Auto.

parameter.name: NAV_ACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default acceptance radius, overridden by acceptance radius of waypoint if set. For fixed wing the L1 turning distance is used for horizontal acceptance.

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set data link loss failsafe mode
parameter.long_desc: The data link loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_DL_LOSS_T in seconds. Once the timeout occurs the selected action will be executed. Setting this parameter to 4 will enable CASA Outback Challenge rules, which are only recommended to participants of that competition.

values.value: Data Link Auto Recovery (CASA Outback Challenge rules)

parameter.name: NAV_FORCE_VT
parameter.short_desc: Force VTOL mode takeoff and land

parameter.name: NAV_FW_ALTL_RAD
parameter.short_desc: FW Altitude Acceptance Radius before a landing
parameter.long_desc: Altitude acceptance used for the last waypoint before a fixed-wing landing. This is usually smaller than the standard vertical acceptance because close to the ground higher accuracy is required.

parameter.name: NAV_FW_ALT_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Acceptance radius for fixedwing altitude.

parameter.name: NAV_LOITER_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Default value of loiter radius for missions, Hold mode, Return mode, etc. (fixedwing only).

parameter.name: NAV_MC_ALT_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Acceptance radius for multicopter altitude.

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The RC loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_RC_LOSS_T in seconds. If RC input checks have been disabled by setting the COM_RC_IN_MODE param it will not be triggered. Setting this parameter to 4 will enable CASA Outback Challenge rules, which are only recommended to participants of that competition.

values.value: RC Auto Recovery (CASA Outback Challenge rules)

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_LT
parameter.short_desc: RC Loss Loiter Time (CASA Outback Challenge rules)
parameter.long_desc: The amount of time in seconds the system should loiter at current position before termination. Only applies if NAV_RCL_ACT is set to 2 (CASA Outback Challenge rules). Set to -1 to make the system skip loitering.

parameter.name: NAV_TRAFF_AVOID
parameter.long_desc: Enabling this will allow the system to respond to transponder data from e.g. ADSB transponders

parameter.name: MNT_DO_STAB
parameter.short_desc: Stabilize the mount (set to true for servo gimbal, false for passthrough). Does not affect MAVLINK_ROI input

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control pitch (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control roll (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAN_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Auxiliary channel to control yaw (in AUX input or manual mode)

parameter.name: MNT_MAV_COMPID
parameter.short_desc: Mavlink Component ID of the mount
parameter.long_desc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLINK, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this component ID.

parameter.name: MNT_MAV_SYSID
parameter.short_desc: Mavlink System ID of the mount
parameter.long_desc: If MNT_MODE_OUT is MAVLINK, mount configure/control commands will be sent with this target ID.

parameter.name: MNT_MODE_IN
parameter.long_desc: RC uses the AUX input channels (see MNT_MAN_* parameters), MAVLINK_ROI uses the MAV_CMD_DO_SET_ROI Mavlink message, and MAVLINK_DO_MOUNT the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL messages to control a mount.

parameter.name: MNT_MODE_OUT
parameter.long_desc: AUX uses the mixer output Control Group #2. MAVLINK uses the MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONFIGURE and MAV_CMD_DO_MOUNT_CONTROL MavLink messages to control a mount (set MNT_MAV_SYSID & MNT_MAV_COMPID)

parameter.name: MNT_OB_LOCK_MODE
parameter.short_desc: Mixer value for selecting a locking mode if required for the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_OB_NORM_MODE
parameter.short_desc: Mixer value for selecting normal mode if required by the gimbal (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Offset for pitch channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Offset for roll channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_OFF_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Offset for yaw channel output in degrees

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Range of pitch channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Range of roll channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MNT_RANGE_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Range of yaw channel output in degrees (only in AUX output mode)

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode Expo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameter.long_desc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode Expo factor for Yaw
parameter.long_desc: Exponential factor for tuning the input curve shape. 0 Purely linear input curve 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_P_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max acro pitch rate default: 2 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_R_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max acro roll rate default: 2 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPO
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Roll and Pitch
parameter.long_desc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_SUPEXPOY
parameter.short_desc: Acro mode SuperExpo factor for Yaw
parameter.long_desc: SuperExpo factor for refining the input curve shape tuned using MC_ACRO_EXPO_Y. 0 Pure Expo function 0.7 resonable shape enhancement for intuitive stick feel 0.95 very strong bent input curve only near maxima have effect

parameter.name: MC_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max acro yaw rate default 1.5 turns per second

parameter.name: MC_AIRMODE
parameter.long_desc: The air-mode enables the mixer to increase the total thrust of the multirotor in order to keep attitude and rate control even at low and high throttle. This function should be disabled during tuning as it will help the controller to diverge if the closed-loop is unstable (i.e. the vehicle is not tuned yet). Enabling air-mode for yaw requires the use of an arming switch.

parameter.name: MC_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameter.long_desc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The copter should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max acceleration at lower battery percentages. i.e. if hover is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameter.name: MC_DTERM_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Cutoff frequency for the low pass filter on the D-term in the rate controller
parameter.long_desc: The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to decrease the driver-level filtering, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_PITCHRATE_K * (MC_PITCHRATE_P * error + MC_PITCHRATE_I * error_integral + MC_PITCHRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_PITCHRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_PITCHRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for pitch rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameter.name: MC_PITCHRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_PITCH_P
parameter.long_desc: Pitch proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_PR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Pitch rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.

parameter.name: MC_RATT_TH
parameter.long_desc: Manual input needed in order to override attitude control rate setpoints and instead pass manual stick inputs as rate setpoints

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_ROLLRATE_K * (MC_ROLLRATE_P * error + MC_ROLLRATE_I * error_integral + MC_ROLLRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_ROLLRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_ROLLRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit for roll rate in manual and auto modes (except acro). Has effect for large rotations in autonomous mode, to avoid large control output and mixer saturation. This is not only limited by the vehicle's properties, but also by the maximum measurement rate of the gyro.

parameter.name: MC_ROLLRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_ROLL_P
parameter.long_desc: Roll proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_RR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Roll rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.

parameter.name: MC_TPA_BREAK_D
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Magnitude of throttle setpoint at which to begin attenuating roll/pitch D gain

parameter.name: MC_TPA_BREAK_I
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Magnitude of throttle setpoint at which to begin attenuating roll/pitch I gain

parameter.name: MC_TPA_BREAK_P
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Magnitude of throttle setpoint at which to begin attenuating roll/pitch P gain

parameter.name: MC_TPA_RATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Rate at which to attenuate roll/pitch D gain Attenuation factor is 1.0 when throttle magnitude is below the setpoint Above the setpoint, the attenuation factor is (1 - rate * (throttle - breakpoint) / (1.0 - breakpoint))

parameter.name: MC_TPA_RATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Rate at which to attenuate roll/pitch I gain Attenuation factor is 1.0 when throttle magnitude is below the setpoint Above the setpoint, the attenuation factor is (1 - rate * (throttle - breakpoint) / (1.0 - breakpoint))

parameter.name: MC_TPA_RATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Throttle PID Attenuation (TPA) Rate at which to attenuate roll/pitch P gain Attenuation factor is 1.0 when throttle magnitude is below the setpoint Above the setpoint, the attenuation factor is (1 - rate * (throttle - breakpoint) / (1.0 - breakpoint))

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_D
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_FF
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_I
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_K
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = MC_YAWRATE_K * (MC_YAWRATE_P * error + MC_YAWRATE_I * error_integral + MC_YAWRATE_D * error_derivative) Set MC_YAWRATE_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set MC_YAWRATE_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: MC_YAWRATE_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: MC_YAW_P
parameter.long_desc: Yaw proportional gain, i.e. desired angular speed in rad/s for error 1 rad.

parameter.name: MC_YR_INT_LIM
parameter.long_desc: Yaw rate integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.

parameter.name: MPC_YAWRAUTO_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max yaw rate in auto mode
parameter.long_desc: Limit the rate of change of the yaw setpoint in autonomous mode to avoid large control output and mixer saturation.

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_DOWN_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes down

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR
parameter.short_desc: Acceleration for auto and for manual
parameter.long_desc: Note: In manual, this parameter is only used in MPC_POS_MODE 1.

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_ESTM
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal acceleration in manual modes when te estimator speed limit is removed. If full stick is being applied and the estimator stops demanding a speed limit, which it had been before (e.g if GPS is gained while flying on optical flow/vision only), the vehicle will accelerate at this rate until the normal position control speed is achieved

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_HOR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal acceleration for auto mode and for manual mode
parameter.long_desc: Manual mode: Maximum deceleration for MPC_POS_MODE 1 and 2. Maximum acceleration and deceleration for MPC_POS_MODE 3. Auto mode: Used with MPC_AUTO_MODE 0 only. For MPC_AUTO_MODE 1, MPC_ACC_HOR is always used.

parameter.name: MPC_ACC_UP_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical acceleration in velocity controlled modes upward

parameter.name: MPC_ALT_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to control height relative to the earth frame origin. This origin may move up and down in flight due to sensor drift. Set to 1 to control height relative to estimated distance to ground. The vehicle will move up and down with terrain height variation. Requires a distance to ground sensor. The height controller will revert to using height above origin if the distance to ground estimate becomes invalid as indicated by the local_position.distance_bottom_valid message being false. Set to 2 to control height relative to ground (requires a distance sensor) when stationary and relative to earth frame origin when moving horizontally. The speed threshold is controlled by the MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY parameter.

parameter.name: MPC_COL_PREV_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Angle left/right from the commanded setpoint in which the range data is used to calculate speed limitations. All data further from the commanded direction is not considered
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: MPC_COL_PREV_D
parameter.short_desc: Minimum distance the vehicle should keep to all obstacles
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode. Collision avoidace is disabled by setting this parameter to a negative value

parameter.name: MPC_COL_PREV_DLY
parameter.short_desc: Average delay of the range sensor message in seconds
parameter.long_desc: Only used in Position mode.

parameter.name: MPC_CRUISE_90
parameter.short_desc: Cruise speed when angle prev-current/current-next setpoint is 90 degrees. It should be lower than MPC_XY_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: Applies only in AUTO modes (includes also RTL / hold / etc.)

parameter.name: MPC_DEC_HOR_SLOW
parameter.short_desc: Slow horizontal manual deceleration for manual mode
parameter.long_desc: Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to 1.

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Deadzone of sticks where position hold is enabled

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_XY
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_HOLD_MAX_Z
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical velocity for which position hold is enabled (use 0 to disable check)

parameter.name: MPC_JERK_AUTO
parameter.long_desc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility. Note: This is only used in jerk-limited trajectory mode (MPC_AUTO_MODE 1)

parameter.name: MPC_JERK_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Limit the maximum jerk of the vehicle (how fast the acceleration can change). A lower value leads to smoother vehicle motions, but it also limits its agility (how fast it can change directions or break). Setting this to the maximum value essentially disables the limit. Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to a smoothing mode 1 or 3.

parameter.name: MPC_JERK_MIN
parameter.long_desc: If this is not zero, a velocity-based maximum jerk limit is used: the applied jerk limit linearly increases with the vehicle's velocity between MPC_JERK_MIN (zero velocity) and MPC_JERK_MAX (maximum velocity). This means that the vehicle's motions are smooth for low velocities, but still allows fast direction changes or breaking at higher velocities. Set this to zero to use a fixed maximum jerk limit (MPC_JERK_MAX). Note: This is only used when MPC_POS_MODE is set to 1.

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_ALT1
parameter.short_desc: Altitude for 1. step of slow landing (descend)
parameter.long_desc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to a value between "MPC_Z_VEL_MAX" and "MPC_LAND_SPEED" to enable a smooth descent experience Value needs to be higher than "MPC_LAND_ALT2"

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_ALT2
parameter.short_desc: Altitude for 2. step of slow landing (landing)
parameter.long_desc: Below this altitude descending velocity gets limited to "MPC_LAND_SPEED" Value needs to be lower than "MPC_LAND_ALT1"

parameter.name: MPC_MANTHR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum vertical thrust. It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust. With MC_AIRMODE set to 1, this can safely be set to 0.

parameter.name: MPC_MAN_TILT_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximal tilt angle in manual or altitude mode

parameter.name: MPC_POS_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The supported sub-modes are: 0 Default position control where sticks map to position/velocity directly. Maximum speeds is MPC_VEL_MANUAL. 1 Smooth position control where setpoints are adjusted based on acceleration limits and jerk limits. 2 Sport mode that is the same Default position control but with velocity limits set to the maximum allowed speeds (MPC_XY_VEL_MAX) 3 Smooth position control with maximum acceleration and jerk limits (different algorithm than 1).

parameter.name: MPC_SPOOLUP_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Enforced delay between arming and takeoff
parameter.long_desc: For altitude controlled modes the time from arming the motors until a takeoff is possible gets forced to be at least MPC_SPOOLUP_TIME seconds to ensure the motors and propellers can sppol up and reach idle speed before getting commanded to spin faster. This delay is particularly useful for vehicles with slow motor spin-up e.g. because of large propellers.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_CURVE
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines how the throttle stick input is mapped to commanded thrust in Manual/Stabilized flight mode. In case the default is used ('Rescale to hover thrust'), the stick input is linearly rescaled, such that a centered stick corresponds to the hover throttle (see MPC_THR_HOVER). Select 'No Rescale' to directly map the stick 1:1 to the output. This can be useful in case the hover thrust is very low and the default would lead to too much distortion (e.g. if hover thrust is set to 20%, 80% of the upper thrust range is squeezed into the upper half of the stick range). Note: In case MPC_THR_HOVER is set to 50%, the modes 0 and 1 are the same.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_HOVER
parameter.long_desc: Vertical thrust required to hover. This value is mapped to center stick for manual throttle control. With this value set to the thrust required to hover, transition from manual to Altitude or Position mode while hovering will occur with the throttle stick near center, which is then interpreted as (near) zero demand for vertical speed. This parameter is also important for the landing detection to work correctly.

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: Limit max allowed thrust

parameter.name: MPC_THR_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum thrust in auto thrust control
parameter.long_desc: It's recommended to set it > 0 to avoid free fall with zero thrust.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_AIR
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt in AUTO and POSCTRL modes during flight.

parameter.name: MPC_TILTMAX_LND
parameter.long_desc: Limits maximum tilt angle on landing.

parameter.name: MPC_TKO_RAMP_T
parameter.short_desc: Position control smooth takeoff ramp time constant
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this value will make automatic and manual takeoff slower. If it's too slow the drone might scratch the ground and tip over. A time constant of 0 disables the ramp

parameter.name: MPC_VELD_LP
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cut freq. for numerical velocity derivative

parameter.name: MPC_VEL_MANUAL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity setpoint for manual controlled mode If velocity setpoint larger than MPC_XY_VEL_MAX is set, then the setpoint will be capped to MPC_XY_VEL_MAX

parameter.name: MPC_XY_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: Normal horizontal velocity in AUTO modes (includes also RTL / hold / etc.) and endpoint for position stabilized mode (POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_XY_MAN_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual position control stick exponential curve sensitivity
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_XY_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_TRAJ_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal trajectory position error

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for horizontal velocity error. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for horizontal velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non-zero value allows to eliminate steady state errors in the presence of disturbances like wind.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity in AUTO mode. If higher speeds are commanded in a mission they will be capped to this velocity.

parameter.name: MPC_XY_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for horizontal velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_YAW_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual control stick yaw rotation exponential curve
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_Z_MAN_EXPO
parameter.short_desc: Manual control stick vertical exponential curve
parameter.long_desc: The higher the value the less sensitivity the stick has around zero while still reaching the maximum value with full stick deflection. 0 Purely linear input curve (default) 1 Purely cubic input curve

parameter.name: MPC_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical position error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_TRAJ_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical trajectory position error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_D
parameter.short_desc: Differential gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_I
parameter.short_desc: Integral gain for vertical velocity error
parameter.long_desc: Non zero value allows hovering thrust estimation on stabilized or autonomous takeoff.

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_DN
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_MAX_UP
parameter.long_desc: Maximum vertical velocity in AUTO mode and endpoint for stabilized modes (ALTCTRL, POSCTRL).

parameter.name: MPC_Z_VEL_P
parameter.short_desc: Proportional gain for vertical velocity error

parameter.name: WV_ROLL_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum roll angle setpoint for weathervane controller to demand a yaw-rate

parameter.name: WV_YRATE_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum yawrate the weathervane controller is allowed to demand

parameter.name: OSD_ATXXXX_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure the ATXXXX OSD Chip (mounted on the OmnibusF4SD board) and select the transmission standard.

parameter.name: MOT_ORDERING
parameter.long_desc: Determines the motor ordering. This can be used for example in combination with a 4-in-1 ESC that assumes a motor ordering which is different from PX4. ONLY supported for Quads. ONLY supported for fmu output (Pixracer or Omnibus F4). When changing this, make sure to test the motor response without props first.

parameter.name: MOT_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Minimum motor rise time (slew rate limit)
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time allowed for the motor input signal to pass through a range of 1000 PWM units. A value x means that the motor signal can only go from 1000 to 2000 PWM in maximum x seconds. Zero means that slew rate limiting is disabled.

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS1
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 1 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS2
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 2 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS3
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 3 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS4
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 4 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS5
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 5 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS6
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 6 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS7
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 7 output
parameter.long_desc: This is the PWM pulse the autopilot is outputting if not armed. When set to -1 the value for PWM_AUX_DISARMED will be used

parameter.name: PWM_AUX_DIS8
parameter.short_desc: Set the disarmed PWM for the auxiliary 8 output

parameter.name: PWM_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Set the maximum PWM for the main outputs
parameter.long_desc: Set to 2000 for industry default or 2100 to increase servo travel.

parameter.name: PWM_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Set the minimum PWM for the main outputs
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1000 for industry default or 900 to increase servo travel.

parameter.name: PWM_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Set the PWM output frequency for the main outputs
parameter.long_desc: Set to 400 for industry default or 1000 for high frequency ESCs. Set to 0 for Oneshot125.

parameter.name: PWM_SBUS_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable S.BUS version 1 output instead of RSSI.

parameter.name: THR_MDL_FAC
parameter.long_desc: Parameter used to model the relationship between static thrust and motor input PWM. Model is: thrust = (1-factor)*PWM + factor * PWM^2

parameter.name: BD_GPROPERTIES
parameter.long_desc: This parameter encodes the ground drag coefficient and the corresponding decrease in wind speed from the plane altitude to ground altitude.

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_CD
parameter.short_desc: Payload drag coefficient of the dropped object
parameter.long_desc: The drag coefficient (cd) is the typical drag constant for air. It is in general object specific, but the closest primitive shape to the actual object should give good results: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drag_coefficient

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_MASS
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: 0.025 kg OBC water bottle: 0.6 kg

parameter.name: BD_OBJ_SURFACE
parameter.long_desc: A typical small toy ball: (0.045 * 0.045) / 4.0 * pi = 0.001590 m^2 OBC water bottle: (0.063 * 0.063) / 4.0 * pi = 0.003117 m^2

parameter.name: BD_PRECISION
parameter.long_desc: If the system is closer than this distance on passing over the drop position, it will release the payload. This is a safeguard to prevent a drop out of the required accuracy.

parameter.name: BD_TURNRADIUS
parameter.long_desc: The planes known minimal turn radius - use a higher value to make the plane maneuver more distant from the actual drop position. This is to ensure the wings are level during the drop.

parameter.name: PLD_BTOUT
parameter.long_desc: Time after which the landing target is considered lost without any new measurements.

parameter.name: PLD_FAPPR_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Allow final approach (without horizontal positioning) if losing landing target closer than this to the ground.

parameter.name: PLD_HACC_RAD
parameter.long_desc: Start descending if closer above landing target than this.

parameter.name: PLD_MAX_SRCH
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of times to seach for the landing target if it is lost during the precision landing.

parameter.name: PLD_SRCH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude above home to which to climb when searching for the landing target.

parameter.name: PLD_SRCH_TOUT
parameter.long_desc: Time allowed to search for the landing target before falling back to normal landing.

parameter.name: RC_RECEIVER_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Acceptable values: - RC_RECEIVER_SPEKTRUM = 1, - RC_RECEIVER_LEMONRX = 2,

parameter.name: RTPS_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run FastRTPS.

parameter.name: RTPS_MAV_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run MAVLink + FastRTPS.

parameter.long_desc: The +- range of this value around the trim value will be considered as zero.

parameter.name: RC15_MAX

parameter.name: RC15_MIN

parameter.name: RC15_REV

parameter.name: RC15_TRIM
parameter.long_desc: Mid point value (has to be set to the same as min for throttle channel).

parameter.name: RC_CHAN_CNT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used by Ground Station software to save the number of channels which were used during RC calibration. It is only meant for ground station use.

parameter.name: RC_FAILS_THR
parameter.long_desc: Set to a value slightly above the PWM value assumed by throttle in a failsafe event, but ensure it is below the PWM value assumed by throttle during normal operation.

parameter.name: RC_FLT_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Cutoff frequency for the low pass filter on roll, pitch, yaw and throttle
parameter.long_desc: Does not get set unless below RC_FLT_SMP_RATE/2 because of filter instability characteristics. Set to 0 to disable the filter.

parameter.name: RC_FLT_SMP_RATE
parameter.short_desc: Sample rate of the remote control values for the low pass filter on roll, pitch, yaw and throttle
parameter.long_desc: Has an influence on the cutoff frequency precision.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX1
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera pitch

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX2
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera roll

parameter.name: RC_MAP_AUX3
parameter.long_desc: Default function: Camera azimuth / yaw

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FAILSAFE
parameter.long_desc: The RC mapping index indicates which channel is used for failsafe If 0, whichever channel is mapped to throttle is used otherwise the value indicates the specific RC channel to use

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM1
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 1st parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM2
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 2nd parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PARAM3
parameter.long_desc: Can be used for parameter tuning with the RC. This one is further referenced as the 3th parameter channel. Set to 0 to deactivate *

parameter.name: RC_MAP_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading pitch inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading roll inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_THROTTLE
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading throttle inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_YAW
parameter.long_desc: The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for reading yaw inputs from. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN
parameter.short_desc: PWM input channel that provides RSSI
parameter.long_desc: 0: do not read RSSI from input channel 1-18: read RSSI from specified input channel Specify the range for RSSI input with RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN and RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX parameters.

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Max input value for RSSI reading
parameter.long_desc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameter.name: RC_RSSI_PWM_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Min input value for RSSI reading
parameter.long_desc: Only used if RC_RSSI_PWM_CHAN > 0

parameter.name: TRIM_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameter.name: TRIM_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameter.name: TRIM_YAW
parameter.long_desc: The trim value is the actuator control value the system needs for straight and level flight. It can be calibrated by flying manually straight and level using the RC trims and copying them using the GCS.

parameter.name: RC_ACRO_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_ARMSWITCH_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_ASSIST_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_AUTO_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_GEAR_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for the landing gear switch
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_KILLSWITCH_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_LOITER_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_MAN_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_MAP_ARM_SW
parameter.long_desc: Use it to arm/disarm via switch instead of default throttle stick. If this is assigned, arming and disarming via stick is disabled.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_FLTMODE
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is non-zero, flight modes are only selected by this channel and are assigned to six slots.

parameter.name: RC_MAP_MODE_SW
parameter.long_desc: This is the main flight mode selector. The channel index (starting from 1 for channel 1) indicates which channel should be used for deciding about the main mode. A value of zero indicates the switch is not assigned.

parameter.name: RC_OFFB_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_POSCTL_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_RATT_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_RETURN_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for selecting return to launch mode
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_STAB_TH
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RC_TRANS_TH
parameter.short_desc: Threshold for the VTOL transition switch
parameter.long_desc: 0-1 indicate where in the full channel range the threshold sits 0 : min 1 : max sign indicates polarity of comparison positive : true when channel>th negative : true when channel<th

parameter.name: RTL_CONE_ANG
parameter.long_desc: Defines the half-angle of the cone which defines the vehicle RTL behavior.

values.value: No cone, always climb to RTL_RETURN_ALT above home.
Only climb to at least RTL_DESCEND_ALT above home.

parameter.name: RTL_DESCEND_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Stay at this altitude above home position after RTL descending. Land (i.e. slowly descend) from this altitude if autolanding allowed.

parameter.name: RTL_LAND_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: Delay after descend before landing in Return mode. If set to -1 the system will not land but loiter at RTL_DESCEND_ALT.

parameter.name: RTL_MIN_DIST
parameter.short_desc: Minimum distance to trigger rising to a safe altitude
parameter.long_desc: If the system is horizontally closer than this distance to home it will land straight on home instead of raising to the return altitude first.

parameter.name: RTL_RETURN_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude to fly back in RTL in meters

parameter.name: RTL_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Fly straight to the home location or planned mission landing and land there or use the planned mission to get to those points.

values.value: Return to a planned mission landing, if available, via direct path, else return to home via direct path
Return to a planned mission landing, if available, using the mission path, else return to home via the reverse mission path

parameter.name: RBCLW_SER_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Roboclaw Driver.

parameter.name: RBCLW_ADDRESS
parameter.long_desc: The Roboclaw can be configured to have an address from 0x80 to 0x87, inclusive. It must be configured to match this parameter.

parameter.name: RBCLW_BAUD
parameter.long_desc: Baud rate of the serial communication with the Roboclaw. The Roboclaw must be configured to match this rate.

parameter.name: RBCLW_COUNTS_REV
parameter.long_desc: Number of encoder counts for one revolution. The roboclaw treats analog encoders (potentiometers) as having 2047 counts per rev. The default value of 1200 corresponds to the default configuration of the Aion R1 rover.

parameter.name: RBCLW_READ_PER
parameter.long_desc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between reading wheel encoder values over Uart from the Roboclaw

parameter.name: RBCLW_WRITE_PER
parameter.long_desc: How long to wait, in Milliseconds, between writing actuator controls over Uart to the Roboclaw

parameter.name: GND_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: GND_L1_DIST
parameter.long_desc: This is the waypoint radius

parameter.name: GND_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: This is the L1 distance and defines the tracking point ahead of the rover it's following. Using values around 2-5 for a traxxas stampede. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: GND_MAX_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum turn angle for Ackerman steering. At a control output of 0, the steering wheels are at 0 radians. At a control output of 1, the steering wheels are at GND_MAX_ANG radians

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_D
parameter.long_desc: This is the derivative gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_I
parameter.long_desc: This is the integral gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maxim value the integral can reach to prevent wind-up.

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_P
parameter.long_desc: This is the proportional gain for the speed closed loop controller

parameter.name: GND_SPEED_THR_SC
parameter.long_desc: This is a gain to map the speed control output to the throttle linearly.

parameter.name: GND_SP_CTRL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: This allows the user to choose between closed loop gps speed or open loop cruise throttle speed

values.value: close the loop with gps speed

parameter.name: GND_THR_CRUISE
parameter.long_desc: This is the throttle setting required to achieve the desired cruise speed. 10% is ok for a traxxas stampede vxl with ESC set to training mode

parameter.name: GND_THR_IDLE
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle while on the ground, it should be 0 for a rover

parameter.name: GND_THR_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum throttle % that can be used by the controller. For a Traxxas stampede vxl with the ESC set to training, 30 % is enough

parameter.name: GND_THR_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This is the minimum throttle % that can be used by the controller. Set to 0 for rover

parameter.name: GND_WHEEL_BASE
parameter.short_desc: Distance from front axle to rear axle

parameter.name: RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL
parameter.short_desc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for takeoff. Pitch up will be commanded when the following airspeed is reached: FW_AIRSPD_MIN * RWTO_AIRSPD_SCL

parameter.name: RWTO_HDG
parameter.short_desc: Specifies which heading should be held during runnway takeoff
parameter.long_desc: 0: airframe heading, 1: heading towards takeoff waypoint

parameter.name: RWTO_MAX_PITCH
parameter.short_desc: Max pitch during takeoff. Fixed-wing settings are used if set to 0. Note that there is also a minimum pitch of 10 degrees during takeoff, so this must be larger if set

parameter.name: RWTO_MAX_ROLL
parameter.short_desc: Max roll during climbout. Roll is limited during climbout to ensure enough lift and prevents aggressive navigation before we're on a safe height

parameter.name: RWTO_MAX_THR
parameter.short_desc: Max throttle during runway takeoff. (Can be used to test taxi on runway)

parameter.name: RWTO_NAV_ALT
parameter.short_desc: Altitude AGL at which we have enough ground clearance to allow some roll. Until RWTO_NAV_ALT is reached the plane is held level and only rudder is used to keep the heading (see RWTO_HDG). This should be below FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF if FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF > 0

parameter.name: RWTO_PSP
parameter.short_desc: Pitch setpoint during taxi / before takeoff airspeed is reached. A taildragger with stearable wheel might need to pitch up a little to keep it's wheel on the ground before airspeed to takeoff is reached

parameter.name: SDLOG_DIRS_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum number of log directories to keep
parameter.long_desc: If there are more log directories than this value, the system will delete the oldest directories during startup. In addition, the system will delete old logs if there is not enough free space left. The minimum amount is 300 MB. If this is set to 0, old directories will only be removed if the free space falls below the minimum. Note: this does not apply to mission log files.

parameter.name: SDLOG_MISSION
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, a small additional "mission" log file will be written to the SD card. The log contains just those messages that are useful for tasks like generating flight statistics and geotagging. The different modes can be used to further reduce the logged data (and thus the log file size). For example, choose geotagging mode to only log data required for geotagging. Note that the normal/full log is still created, and contains all the data in the mission log (and more).

parameter.name: SDLOG_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Determines when to start and stop logging. By default, logging is started when arming the system, and stopped when disarming.

parameter.name: SDLOG_PROFILE
parameter.long_desc: This integer bitmask controls the set and rates of logged topics. The default allows for general log analysis and estimator replay, while keeping the log file size reasonably small. Enabling multiple sets leads to higher bandwidth requirements and larger log files. Set bits true to enable: 0 : Default set (used for general log analysis) 1 : Full rate estimator (EKF2) replay topics 2 : Topics for thermal calibration (high rate raw IMU and Baro sensor data) 3 : Topics for system identification (high rate actuator control and IMU data) 4 : Full rates for analysis of fast maneuvers (RC, attitude, rates and actuators) 5 : Debugging topics (debug_*.msg topics, for custom code) 6 : Topics for sensor comparison (low rate raw IMU, Baro and Magnetomer data) 7 : Topics for computer vision and collision avoidance

parameter.name: SDLOG_UTC_OFFSET
parameter.long_desc: the difference in hours and minutes from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for a your place and date. for example, In case of South Korea(UTC+09:00), UTC offset is 540 min (9*60) refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UTC_time_offsets

parameter.name: SDLOG_UUID
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1, add an ID to the log, which uniquely identifies the vehicle

parameter.name: SIM_BAT_MIN_PCT
parameter.short_desc: Simulator Battery minimal percentage. Can be used to alter the battery level during SITL- or HITL-simulation on the fly. Particularly useful for testing different low-battery behaviour

parameter.name: CAL_ACC0_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_ACC1_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_ACC2_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 0 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal magnetometer will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 1 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal magnetometer will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 2 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal magnetometer will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 2 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal magnetometer will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameter.long_desc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameter.long_desc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameter.short_desc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor. Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameter.short_desc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_CMODEL
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
parameter.long_desc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBELEN
parameter.long_desc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG_SIDES
parameter.short_desc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
parameter.long_desc: DETECT_ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 DETECT_ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 DETECT_ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 DETECT_ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 DETECT_ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 DETECT_ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32

parameter.name: IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Driver level cutoff frequency for accel
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the accel driver. This features is currently supported by the mpu6000 and mpu9250. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Driver level cutoff frequency for gyro
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the gyro driver. This features is currently supported by the mpu6000 and mpu9250. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_CM8JL65_CFG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run Lanbao PSK-CM8JL65-CC5.

parameter.name: SENS_CM8JL65_R_0
parameter.long_desc: Distance Sensor Rotation as MAV_SENSOR_ORIENTATION enum

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the PX4FLOW board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle. The recommneded installation default for the PX4FLOW board is with the Y axis forward (270 deg yaw).

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_I

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_P

parameter.name: SIH_IXX
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IXY
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IXZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IYY
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IYZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IZZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_KDV
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]

parameter.name: SIH_KDW
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_H0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LAT0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LON0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_X
parameter.short_desc: North magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the North magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Y
parameter.short_desc: East magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the East magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Z
parameter.short_desc: Down magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the Down magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_L_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.

parameter.name: SIH_L_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.

parameter.name: SIH_MASS
parameter.long_desc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.

parameter.name: SIH_Q_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.

parameter.name: SIH_T_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.

parameter.name: UART_ESC_BAUD
parameter.long_desc: Default rate is 250Kbps, whic is used in off-the-shelf QRP ESC products.

parameter.name: UART_ESC_MODEL
parameter.long_desc: See esc_model_t enum definition in uart_esc_dev.h for all supported ESC model enum values.

parameter.name: LED_RGB1_MAXBRT
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for minimum brightness up to 31 (max)

parameter.name: LED_RGB_MAXBRT
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for minimum brightness up to 15 (max)

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameter.short_desc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameter.name: SYS_FMU_TASK
parameter.short_desc: Run the FMU as a task to reduce latency
parameter.long_desc: If true, the FMU will run in a separate task instead of on the work queue. Set this if low latency is required, for example for racing. This is a trade-off between RAM usage and latency: running as a task, it requires a separate stack and directly polls on the control topics, whereas running on the work queue, it runs at a fixed update rate.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HITL
parameter.short_desc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameter.long_desc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally.

parameter.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameter.long_desc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameter.name: SYS_PARAM_VER
parameter.long_desc: This is used internally only: an airframe configuration might set an expected parameter version value via PARAM_DEFAULTS_VER. This is checked on bootup against SYS_PARAM_VER, and if they do not match, parameters from the airframe configuration are reloaded.

parameter.name: SYS_RESTART_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Set by px4io to indicate type of restart

parameter.name: SYS_USE_IO
parameter.long_desc: Can be used to use a standard startup script but with a FMU only set-up. Set to 0 to force the FMU only set-up.

parameter.name: TEL_BST_EN
parameter.long_desc: If true, the FMU will try to connect to Blacksheep telemetry on start up

parameter.name: TEL_FRSKY_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run FrSky Telemetry.

parameter.name: TEL_HOTT_CONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Configure on which serial port to run HoTT Telemetry.
